posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.41 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ New networking stack at play, let us know if you see any network related issues
★ We’ve added a lot of changes around navigation/main conversation screen (continuing from 7.40) e.g. megaphones, searching, tabs
★ Tons of bug fixes

Complete list of new commits since 7.40.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.40.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.40 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.41.0 (153900)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

101 new commits since 7.40.2:

Show commits

  • Fallback to local reglock data if available when registering a previously verified session. [1]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.5 [2]

  • Do not send sync messages if we have no linked devices. [3]

  • Update quote icon for scheduled send. [4]

  • Fix InputAwareLayout incorrectly overriding height in bubble mode. [5]

  • Fix some media not appearing in the gallery picker. [6]

    Works around the glide issue by using the straight URI when possible,
    which allows glide to not have to keep a buffer. However, as soon as you
    select it, it'll be an encrypted file, and we'll run into this same
    issue where glide needs to keep a buffer for the input stream.
    Related to #11014

  • Enable backups v2 for internal users. [7]

  • Update aesgcmprovider to 0.0.4 [8]

  • Update conscrypt to 2.5.3 [9]

  • Fix incorrect embedded druation in certain MP4 files. [10]

    The root cause:

    • some MP4 files come with H.264/H.265 streams which explicitly
      state their timescale. In such cases, it is wise that MP4 muxer
      adopts these values
    • unfortunately, the recent trend has been that such values coming
      from video stream SPS (vui_parameters/timing info) are exorbitantly
      high - instead of being FPS *1000, they tend to be FPS * 100,000,000
    • when trying to express the duration of the movie, the MP4 muxer
      normally tries to find the adequate timescale value which will
      fit both audio and video timescaling domains. The most suitable
      approach is that the LCM (least common multiplier) value is taken
      which mathematically will be the least disruptive.
      HOWEVER:
    • in cases when video and timescale numeric values are mutually 'odd',
      say 30*100,000,000 and 44100, the LCM ends up being a huge number,
      which outgrows the 32-bit storage capacity granted by the ISO MP4
      spec (MVHD box).
      Problem solution:
    1. identifying when the LCM timescale exceeds 32-bit storage space
    2. scaling down its value by nearest larger 10X factor, which will
      guarantee its value fitting the 32-bit space. Given the afore
      mentioned video timescale factors, dividing by 10X is harmless
    3. rescaling the duration 64-bit value based on the new timescale

  • Create new sticker management screen with tabbed interface. [11]

    Adds a skeleton implementation of StickerManagementActivityV2. This new activity is not currently connected to anything, but once complete it will replace StickerManagementActivity.

  • Avoid setting blank group names. [12]

  • Avoid sending blank story. [13]

  • Avoid setting blank custom story name. [14]

  • Support drag multi-selection for media gallery. [15]

  • Avoid blocking yourself. [16]

  • Support hiding image caption with press and hold. [17]

  • Add accessibility labels for GIF categories and correct emoji labels. [18]

  • Decouple InlineQueryViewModelV2 instance from activity, parent to fragment instead. [19]

  • Fix syncing crash when no archived media exists. [20]

  • Fix another syncing crash when no archived media exists. [21]

  • Add system HTTP proxy support to libsignal-net. [22]

  • Temporarily remove bad assertion in MessageBackupsFlowViewModel. [23]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.70.0 [24]

  • Add storage service optimization to avoid manifest reads. [25]

  • Add glyph icons and SignalSymbol methods. [26]

  • Remove ConversationTabs* and migrate to MainActivity. [27]

  • Dialog color fixes. [28]

  • Allow specification of whether we utilize windowTypes to lay out inset guidelines. [29]

  • Fix resend button visibility logic. [30]

  • Add correct dialog message while blocking group. [31]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.6 [32]

  • Fix SearchView loosing focus. [33]

  • Avoid message failed notification when bubble thread is visible. [34]

  • Add logging to BackupsSettingsViewModel to help track down data loading race. [35]

  • Hide keyboard when navigating back to chat list via toolbar. [36]

  • Ensure keystore operations happen on the same thread. [37]

  • Make system keyboard sticker detection more reliable. [38]

  • Fix Video call screen bottom sheet weird animation and height. [39]

  • Move background color selection into theme. [40]

  • Add MainContentLayoutData object and proper scaffolding directive. [41]

  • Separate sheet that requires payment flow. [42]

  • Sticker management v2 - Display available and installed stickers. [43]

  • Add TransferProgressIndicator composable. [44]

    Adds a composable version of TransferProgressView.

  • Tweak Network.transformAndSetRemoteConfig to match changes to libsignal's RemoteConfig spec. [45]

  • Wire up nav rail fabs and fix animation playing on leaving a tab. [46]

  • Add additional local metrics around storage service writes/reads. [47]

  • Fix message info screen updates. [48]

  • Fix transfer controls logic for checking isUpload. [49]

  • Avoid opening Media preview for not sent media. [50]

  • Return an empty list instead of crashing when calling participantAcis. [51]

  • Show correct message for empty archived screen. [52]

  • Convert StickerManagementRepository to kotlin. [53]

    Converts StickerManagementRepository to kotlin, so getStickerPacks() can return a Flow that emits updates after the database is changed.
    This change simplifies the implementation of StickerManagmentViewModelV2, since StickerManagementRepository.getStickerPacks() will now automatically register and unregister the database observer.

  • Dynamic split pane support via internal setting. [54]

  • Align pin reminder skip behavior with iOS. [55]

  • Convert avatar migration to just be a force push. [56]

  • Filter out bad E164s from GV1 groups. [57]

  • Improve choose chats save button enabled state. [58]

  • Add accessibility labels for MainToolbar. [59]

  • Avoid setting blank folder name. [60]

  • Update TransferProgressIndicator to support indeterminate progress. [61]

    Showing exact progress for sticker pack downloads is more complicated than necessary. This PR updates TransferProgressIndicator to support displaying indeterminate progress.

    Changeset

    • Display indeterminate progress when installing a sticker pack.
    • Remove cancel button from AvailableStickerPackRow.
    • Decrease progress indicator size to match updated design.

  • Add additional safeguards around storage sync types. [62]

  • Add additional logging around storage batch sizes. [63]

  • Address possible invalid e164's in storage service splits. [64]

  • Add close icon in search toolbar. [65]

  • Add notification profile id for backupsv2. [66]

  • Include AEP in link device provisioning message. [67]

  • Upgrade to mobilecoin to 6.1.2 for 16kb alignment. [68]

  • Replace glyphs in group update messages. [69]

  • Sticker management v2 - Implement sticker pack installation. [70]

    Adds the ability to install sticker packs using StickerManagementActivityV2.
    When the install button is clicked, it will morph into an indeterminate progress bar, which will then animate into a checkmark once the installation completes successfully. Then a couple seconds later, the sticker pack row will be removed from the available sticker packs list.

  • Open keyboard for a Draft message. [71]

  • Add StickerPackId and StickerPackKey value classes. [72]

  • Move to quoted message on quote preview click. [73]

  • Send error message after cancelling a link+sync. [74]

  • Fix unread count for edited messages. [75]

  • Update banner message for debug log. [76]

  • Ensures chat folder is remembered when we leave page. [77]

  • Ensure story viewed list in proper alphabetical order. [78]

  • Show correct time for Story view item. [79]

  • Convert change number back to WebSocket. [80]

  • Fix unreads for new unread count scheme. [81]

  • Pause and play video correctly on TimeBar scrub drag. [82]

  • Add remote config for libsignal-net rollout. [83]

  • Avoid message click listeners in Scheduled messages sheet. [84]

  • Remove main-thread usage of Recipient.self. [85]

  • Implement activated state for conversation list items. [86]

  • Fix incorrect span indices for normalised search text. [87]

  • Limit work that happens in LiveRecipientCache lock. [88]

  • Make e164 formatter more leinent with + prefix. [89]

  • Fix a few random crashes when using libsignal-net. [90]

  • Revert "Depend on libsignal-net's connection backoff instead of duplicating at app-level." [91]

  • Do not process messages while pending restore decision. [92]

  • Sticker management v2 - Implement drag and drop. [93]

    Adds the ability to use drag and drop to rearrange installed sticker packs.

  • Fix chat folders flickering during drag and drop. [94]

    Fixes the UI flickering that occurs when reordering chat folders. The issue was caused by the ViewModel updating the database each time a list item position changes when we were already updating list order in the UI state manually at the same time.

  • Add support for conversation intent routing to MainActivity. [95]

  • Trim text before performing username search. [96]

  • Prevent search state from clearing if user did not send a message. [97]

  • Add fixes for streamable videos. [98]

  • Update translations and other static files. [99]

  • Update baseline profile. [100]

  • Bump version to 7.41.0 [101]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.40.2…v7.41.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution
Jump to quoted message when drafting reply

posts.cooked:
cody-signal:

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ New sticker management screen, check it out!

This was removed 5 minutes ago?

Edit 1: now I see this commit:

updates-bot:

Create new sticker management screen with tabbed interface. [11]

Adds a skeleton implementation of StickerManagementActivityV2. This new activity is not currently connected to anything, but once complete it will replace StickerManagementActivity.

Edit 2:

updates-bot:

Move to quoted message on quote preview click. [73]

Nice little feature! I wonder how long it takes for WhatsApp to copy this

Edit 3:

updates-bot:

Ensure story viewed list in proper alphabetical order. [78]

Nice, thanks!

Edit 4:

updates-bot:

Sticker management v2 - Implement drag and drop. [93]

Adds the ability to use drag and drop to rearrange installed sticker packs.

Hopefully you can show a one-time animation or highlight of this new feature! For people who regularly use stickers in Signal.

link_counts.title: Jump to quoted message when drafting reply

posts.cooked:
Aku-Stable:
updates-bot:

Move to quoted message on quote preview click [73]

Nice little feature! I wonder how long it takes for WhatsApp to copy this

Ah, it’s about the message draft… I was wondering first

Aku-Stable:
updates-bot:

Adds the ability to use drag and drop to rearrange installed sticker packs.

Hopefully you can show a one-time animation or highlight of this new feature!

This isn’t new and was already possible for ages (to rearrange, you have to click the at the end of the sticker pack rail to get to the management page, where you can long-press to move a pack)

PiCob:

This isn’t new and was already possible for ages (to rearrange, you have to click the at the end of the sticker pack rail to get to the management page, where you can long-press to move a pack)

Whaaaaat! Today I learned

So is this NOT a new feature in 7.41?
Nope, definitely not new. The commit only implemented this for the upcoming new Sticker management as well.

posts.name: Bme13
posts.cooked:
After installation and restoring from a backup file I noticed the chat backgrounds were not set. When trying to set an image as background the app keeps crashing. First I’ve noticed the app did not have permission to photos, but even after setting that it remains crashing. Also tried to reset backgrounds, but that didn’t help. I can set a custom background color, but not select an image.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.41.0/ab0e762302fd95cbc065021a3cd3d8362aa8770ae2a155f6eb89c2c4c1c9f872
Edit - Just realized I’m still able to access Signal on the old phone, also running 7.41.0 and it has the same issue. So it has nothing to do with the restoring process

posts.name: Masqueey
posts.cooked: Milan, good job on figuring that mp4 thing out and then fixing it! Nice job!

posts.name: Masqueey
posts.cooked: Quickly creating a blank folder before I update and it won’t be possible anymore

Can’t change my profile picture when selecting pictures from the phone. It either crashes or sends me back to the settings. Don’t know if there is something in the log:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.41.0/3ab277776bd25e0a5bdedff16e92d6360fc97bb3f83807965abd426f29c98989

posts.name: Kaartic Sivaraam
posts.cooked: +1. Facing the same profile picture update issue

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Just noticed the new icon styles for status messages such as calls and group changes are in italics on the new chat list.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
I was about to send a photo taken from the in-app camera when I received a message in the same chat (ID 1745700106229), and the camera had a soft crash and the chat got closed, sending me back to the chat list activity.

Debug logs

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: But ofc isn’t yet supported on iOS (yes I know this is the android beta thread, still annoying though, not trying to be rude to the iOS devs though, they’re trying their hardest)

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Seems like video size calculation is bugged. Also, seeking seems to be broken in videos as tapping to seek or swiping on the seek bar just seems to go through to the background triggering a scroll.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.41.0/f0dfde2bebc9193692d8964e59ba50a64bb312981678370ab1cfcf22ec09a7c3

10000316911024×2279 148 KB

link_counts.title: Feedback about the new default avatars (Android 5.18, iOS 5.17)

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
bme13:

When trying to set an image as background the app keeps crashing.

piratenpanda:

Can’t change my profile picture when selecting pictures from the phone. It either crashes

sivaraam:

Facing the same profile picture update issue

Yup, sorry about this, working on it. Top priority.

Whatnoww:

Just noticed the new icon styles for status messages such as calls and group changes are in italics on the new chat list.

So? We’ll task design if they wanted this or just side effect of glyph replacement.

hmzuleta:

the camera had a soft crash and the chat got closed

Looks like you hit an out of memory error. Fluke-ish crash. Thanks for the report.

Whatnoww:

Seems like video size calculation is bugged. Also, seeking seems to be broken in videos as tapping to seek or swiping on the seek bar just seems to go through to the background triggering a scroll.

I couldn’t repro, feels video content related. Was this a video from Instagram or somewhere specific? Could you try other videos from there and ones from your camera to see if the same things happen?

New Version: 7.41.1 (154000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

6 new commits since 7.41.0:

  • Improve envelope timestamp validation. [1]

  • Add more logging for chat folders during storage sync. [2]

  • Fix MediaSelectionViewModel crash. [3]

  • Don't call single.onError with IOException in LibSignalChatConnection::sendRequest. [4]

  • Update translations and other static files. [5]

  • Bump version to 7.41.1 [6]

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.41.0/ac3e8afa225d208e6ae89c536d27eb57e37248e620178214b38cf3ac2da419a2

Message ID:
1745909741597

posts.name: Anon
posts.cooked:
Every single time I call someone or someone calls me on Signal I don’t get the call notification with buttons to answer/deny the call or I don’t get the call notification AT ALL.

I didn’t get the message notification maybe two times, but I constantly miss the calls.

Signal has been absolutely terrible and unreliable for the past two months but especially for the past 2-3 weeks.

I got One UI 7 (Android 15) update on my S23 yesterday, and I cleared the cache, updated Signal and everything but the same problem still persists.
